text:
{
"persons_mentioned": [
"Émile Zola",
"M. Félix Faure",
"Dreyfus",
"Général Mercier",
"Commandant du Paty de Clam",
"Général de Boisdeffre",
"Général Billot",
"Lieutenant-Colonel Picquart",
"Commandant Esterhazy",
"M. Scheurer-Kestner",
"Général Gonse",
"M. Cavaignac",
"Général de Pellieux",
"M. Bertulus",
"M. G. Lebon"
],
"places_mentioned": [
"Paris",
"France",
"Tunisie"
],
"general_topic": "An open letter (J'accuse...!) addressed to the President of the Republic, M. Félix Faure, in which Émile Zola accuses high-ranking French military and judicial officials (including Generals Mercier, Boisdeffre, Billot, and Gonse) of a deliberate conspiracy and cover-up to protect the true traitor, Commandant Esterhazy, while unjustly maintaining the conviction of Captain Alfred Dreyfus, thereby demanding a revision of the case.",
"important_dates": [
"Jeudi 13 Janvier 1898"
]
}
